H0.text: The net force exerted by the seat belt on the crash dummy during a collision is in the same direction as the crash dummy's motion.

H1.text: The net force exerted by the seat belt is in a vertical direction compared to the direction of the crash dummy's motion during a collision.

H2.text: The net force exerted by the seat belt is in a downward direction relative to the crash dummy’s motion during a collision when the seat belt slows the dummy’s speed.

H3.text: The seat belt exerts a net force in the opposite direction of the crash dummy’s motion during a collision, which slows the dummy’s speed.

A4.text: A seat belt applies an opposing force to the driver and passengers to prevent them from falling out or making contact with the interior of the car
